title: Literature of Mithila
content: Mithila has a rich literary tradition dating back centuries, with works in Sanskrit, Maithili, and other languages.
The region has produced many renowned poets, writers, and scholars who have contributed significantly to Indian literature.
Mithila literature encompasses various genres including poetry, drama, philosophy, and religious texts.

authors.name: Vidyapati
authors.bio: A 14th-century poet known for his love songs and devotional poetry in Maithili.

authors.name: Chanda Jha
authors.bio: A 20th-century Maithili writer and linguist who played a crucial role in the promotion of Maithili language and literature.

authors.name: Gangesh Upadhyaya
authors.bio: A 12th-century philosopher and logician who founded the Navya-Nyaya school of Indian logic.

authors.name: Jyotirishwar Thakur
authors.bio: A 14th-century writer known for his work on poetry and dramaturgy.

authors.name: Mandan Mishra
authors.bio: An 8th-century philosopher and author of several works on Mimamsa philosophy.

authors.name: Kavi Kokil
authors.bio: A 17th-century poet known for his works in Maithili, often called the 'Cuckoo of Poetry' for his melodious verse.

authors.name: Harimohan Jha
authors.bio: A 20th-century Maithili humorist and novelist, celebrated for his satirical works.

authors.name: Maithili Thakur
authors.bio: Maithili Thakur is a prominent contemporary singer and performer known for her contributions to Maithili folk music.

authors.name: Lalit Narayan Mishra
authors.bio: A 20th-century Maithili poet and scholar, known for his contributions to Maithili literature and his efforts to promote the Maithili language.
